section.title: Popup
section.para: This command has two purposes: to bind a menu to a key or mouse button, and to bind a sub menu into a menu. The formats for the two purposes differ slightly. The position arguments are the same as for . The command default-action is invoked if the user clicks a button to invoke the menu and releases it immediately again (or hits the key rapidly twice if the menu is bound to a key). If the default action is not specified, double clicking on the menu does nothing. However, if the menu begins with a menu item (i.e. not with a title or a separator) and the default action is not given, double clicking invokes the first item of the menu (but only if the pointer really was over the item).
To bind a previously defined pop-up menu to a key or mouse button:

The following example binds mouse buttons 2 and 3 to a pop-up called "Window Ops". The menu pops up if the buttons 2 or 3 are pressed in the window frame, side-bar, or title-bar, with no modifiers (none of shift, control, or meta).
section.programlisting: 2 FST N Popup "Window Ops" 3 FST N Popup "Window Ops"
section.para:
Pop-ups can be bound to keys through the use of the
command. Pop-ups can be operated without using the mouse by binding to keys and operating via the up arrow, down arrow, and enter keys.
To bind a previously defined pop-up menu to another menu, for use as a sub menu:
The following example defines a sub menu "Quit-Verify" and binds it into a main menu, called "RootMenu":
section.programlisting:
Quit-Verify + "Really Quit Fvwm?" + "Yes, Really Quit" + "Restart Fvwm" + "Restart Fvwm 1.xx" fvwm1 -s + "" + "No, Don't Quit"
RootMenu "Root Menu" + "Open XTerm Window" Popup NewWindowMenu + "Login as Root" exec xterm -T Root -n Root -e su - + "Login as Anyone" AnyoneMenu + "Remote Hosts" HostMenu + "" + "X utilities" Popup Xutils + "" + "Fvwm Modules" Popup Module-Popup + "Fvwm Window Ops" Popup Window-Ops + "" + "Previous Focus" (AcceptsFocus) + "Next Focus" (AcceptsFocus) + "" + "Refresh screen" + "" + "Reset X defaults" xrdb -load \ $HOME/.Xdefaults + "" + "" + Popup Quit-Verify
section.para:
Popup differs from
in that pop-ups do not stay up if the user simply clicks. These are popup-menus, which are a little hard on the wrist.
menus stay up on a click action. See the
command for an explanation of the interactive behavior of menus. A menu can be open up to ten times at once, so a menu may even use itself or any of its predecessors as a sub menu.
